contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary}} '''MTS''' may refer to: {{TOC right}} == Business == * [[Member of Technical Staff]], the title for permanent research staff at some institutions and companies * [[Make to stock]], periodic or flow production of (normally) few product variations to stock == Computers == * [[Michigan Terminal System]], a mainframe operating system * [[Microsoft Transaction Server]], software whose functionality is now in COM+ * [[.mts]], a container file format used for multiplexing audio, video and other streams == Education == * [[Master of Theological Studies]], a general academic degree * [[Ministry Training Strategy]], an Australian based apprenticeship for evangelical Christian ministry * [[Merchant Taylors' School, Northwood]] one of the UK's major independent schools, founded in 1561 == Medicine and biology == * [[Malaysian Trumpet Snails]], a small freshwater snail with red spots on a green-brown shell * [[Mesial temporal sclerosis]], a specific pattern of hippocampal neuron cell loss in temporal lobe epilepsy * [[Mohr-Tranebjaerg syndrome]], causes severe deafness and dystonia caused by mutation in the TIMM8A gene * [[MTS assay]], a biochemical cell assay used in research * [[Muirâ€“Torre syndrome]], a subtype of HNPCC cancer caused by the genes MLH1 & MSH2 == Organizations == * [[Machine and Tractor Station]], a state enterprise of agricultural machinery in the Soviet Union and Bulgaria * [[Manitoba Teachers' Society]], 1919-present, a Manitoba, Canada teacher union * [[Marine Technology Society]], a society of marine engineers, technologists, policy makers and educators * [[Metro Transport Sydney]], 1997-present, a light rail and monorail operator in Sydney, Australia * [[Millennium Transit Services]], 2003-2009, a United States bus builder * [[MTS Systems Corporation]], 1966-present, a testing and sensing solutions company * [[Metropolitan Transit System]], 1886-present, a public transit operator in San Diego * [[Manitoba Telecom Services]], a Manitoba, Canada land-line and wireless provider * [[Mobile Telephony of Serbia]], a subsidiary of Telekom Srbija * [[Mobile TeleSystems]], a Russian mobile phone provider * [[MTS Ukraine]], a Ukrainian service provider * [[MTS India]], an Indian service provider * [[Merchant Taylors' School (disambiguation)]], several == Science and technology == * [[Multichannel television sound]], a method of encoding three additional audio channels into a single NTSC-format audio carrier * [[MIDI Tuning Standard]], a specification of precise musical pitch * [[Metre-tonne-second system of units]], '''mts''', large scale analog of the CGS system * [[Metrical task system]], mathematical objects used in the context of online algorithms * [[Mobile Telephone System]], or Manual Tone Shift, an early mobile telephone standard * [[Movement Tracking System]], a United States military communications and logistics system * [[MPEG transport stream]] == Video games == * [[Microsoft Train Simulator]], a 2001 Windows video game {{disambig}}
